titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Judy Blume Papers
titlestmt.author: Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The Judy Blume papers consist of correspondence, manuscripts, printed material, audiovisual material, computer media, and personal and other papers documenting the life and work of American author Judy Blume.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Acquired from various sources. For more information consult the appropriate curator.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research with the requirement that all users of the Papers must sign an agreement outlining specific conditions for use of the papers. These conditions are related to the presence of letters, documents and other materials that were written by children and other individuals to Ms. Blume on issues and topics that are personal to the writer. The Papers also contains copies of letters written by Ms. Blume responding to correspondence from her readers. These materials are in some cases catalogued as "correspondence" and in other cases are interspersed throughout the Papers.
Boxes 6, 92-103 (audiovisual material): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Boxes 23, 104-105, 119 (born digital): Restricted fragile material. Access copies of digital files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Judy Blume papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Judy Blume Papers. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two subgroupings: October 2017 Acquisition and September 2018 Acquistion.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed to a preliminary level in 2018. Preliminary processing included rehousing and listing of material. Materials within boxes and folders have not been sorted.

Descriptive information found in the Collection Contents section of this finding aid is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the list below are based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian; folder titles transcribed from those provided by the creator or previous custodian are indicated by quotation marks. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

bioghist.head: Judy Blume (1938-)
bioghist.p: Judy Blume is an American author, educator, and advocate. She was born and raised in Elizabeth, New Jersey, before attending Boston University and New York University, where she earned a B.S. degree in Education in 1960. She is the author of over 30 books, most of which are written for children and young adults, dating from The One in the middle is the green kangaroo (1969) to In the unlikely event (2015).
Summary information is also available in the standard print and online biographical resources.
The following chronology provides dates for key events and selected publications:

graduates from New York University with a B.S. degree in Education

publication of Are you there God? It's me, Margaret , awarded Outstanding Book of the Year, New York Times

publication of It's not the end of the world

eventgrp.event: publication of Just as long as we're together

chronitem.event: publication of Summer sisters
publication of Fudge-a-mania

awarded the Margaret A. Edwards Award for Lifetime Achievement, American Library Association

awarded medal for Distinguished Contribution to American Letters, National Book Foundation
publication of In the unlikely event

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Judy Blume papers consist of correspondence, drafts of writings, printed material, audiovisual material, computer media, and personal and other papers documenting the life and work of American author Judy Blume.

Correspondence is located throughout the collection and identified chiefly as professional, personal, and fan mail. Professional correspondence includes letters from publishers and literary and other organizations. Letters from fans are grouped together by date, by topic, and, in some cases, by individual correspondent.

Writings include manuscript drafts, proofs, and other materials. Multiple drafts can be found for many titles, including: Deenie (1973), Tiger eyes (1981), Smart women (1983), Just as long as we're together (1987), Fudge-a-mania (1990), Here's to you, Rachel Robinson (1993), Summer sisters (1998), Double Fudge (2002), and In the unlikely event (2015).

Other papers include awards, clippings, photographs, printed material, research and subject files, and material relating to public appearances and events, such as interviews, speeches, and book and promotional tours. Audiovisual materials in the collection appear to document Blume's public appearances.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three subgroupings: I. Key West Material, 1952-2017. II. Glenn Horowitz Bookseller Office Material, 1956-2001. III. October 2017 Addition, 1961-2017.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Boxes 6, 92-103 (audiovisual material): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Boxes 23, 104-105, 119 (born digital): Restricted fragile material. Access copies of digital files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The October 2017 Acquisition came to the library in multiple shipments in Fall 2017 and has been grouped according to where the material originated or was stored and the time of receipt by the library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Material has been left in the order in which it was received by the library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The largest component of the October 2017 Acquisition is from Judy Blume's residence in Key West, Florida. The Key West materials include correspondence, drafts and proofs of writings, research and subject files, professional papers, printed material, personal papers, photographs, audiovisual materials, and born-digital (electronic) files.

Drafts, proofs, and other materials can be found for numerous books by Blume, and in some cases multiple drafts can be found for individual tiles, including: Double Fudge (2002), Summer sisters (1998), Deenie (1973), Tiger eyes (1981), and In the unlikely event (2015).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Glenn Horowitz Bookseller Office Material consists chiefly of correspondence dating from the late 1990s and early 2000s and writings. Drafts and proofs can be found for many books by Blume, and in some cases multiple drafts can be found for individual tiles, including: Just as long as we're together (1987), Smart women (1983), Here's to you, Rachel Robinson (1993), and Fudge-a-mania (1990).
